head.title: Congressman Is Seeking Release of Jailed Student

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Government, Philanthropy and NGO

hedline.hl1: Congressman Is Seeking Release of Jailed Student

abstract.p: Representative Christopher H Smith says he will travel to Myanmar to push for release of Michelle Keegan, New Jersey college student arrested there for distributing pro-democracy pamphlets (S)

block.p: Representative Christopher H. Smith said he would travel to Myanmar today to push for the release of a New Jersey college student arrested there on Sunday for distributing pro-democracy pamphlets.

The student, Michelle Keegan, 19, of Hamilton Township, was taken into custody with 17 other foreigners, including 5 other Americans, in Yangon, the capital city, for distributing literature the government said was intended to incite unrest.
Representative Christopher H. Smith said he would travel to Myanmar today to push for the release of a New Jersey college student arrested there on Sunday for distributing pro-democracy pamphlets.

The student, Michelle Keegan, 19, of Hamilton Township, was taken into custody with 17 other foreigners, including 5 other Americans, in Yangon, the capital city, for distributing literature the government said was intended to incite unrest.

A State Department official said yesterday that a top American diplomat in Myanmar visited the American detainees and reported that they were in good condition.. Mr. Smith said that Ms. Keegan, who was to be a sophomore this fall at American University in Washington, traveled to Yangon to help commemorate the 10th anniversary of a violent government crackdown on pro-democracy demonstrators.

The Congressman, a Republican from Washington Township who chairs the House Subcommittee on International Relations and Human Rights, said he was asked to intervene by Ms. Keegan's father, a Trenton police officer.
